intro: Elopium surinamense, commonly known as the Surinam elopium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
